ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 2 hours/week
2 hours
30 min
2 hours
1 hour
1-2 hours on normal weeks, 2 hours on midterm weeks
6 hrs

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Everything about this course was great, with the small exception of the extra lunchtime lectures during the second half of the semester. Staying to see the speaker for an additional hour is great when I have the time, but repeatedly being told that the extra hour was mandatory (when noon is often a time when meetings are scheduled for other groups or with advisors) was a little frustrating.
Great introduction to all aspects of clinical trial development and stats; wonderful integration into real world/industry.
I learned a lot in regulatory affairs. It's a great course and I think one of my favorites at YSPH. The text book is great!

The course provides a strong overview of regulatory affairs, and Professor Makuch brings a lot of expertise and personal experience in the course. I was particularly happy to hear from other guest lecturers from diverse backgrounds (pharma, law, FDA)

This was an amazing class - gave the opportunity to learn the basics about the FDA and regulatory approval for new drugs and biologics. Not to mention that half of the class is driven by speakers from all parts of the regulatory environment both domestic and global. Keep it just the way it is!

Overall, I think this course is fantastic. The material, while not covered in class all the time, was sufficiently covered in the textbook and in the professor's slides. Where the value is in this course is with the professor himself. His stories and knowledge of the industry is an endless resource for students interested in the field, and anyone considering a reg affairs path should take this course. Perhaps the course could be a bit more focused on figuring out what students should ultimately walk away from in the course, as it felt a little too broad and unfocused at times.
Great overview of regulatory environment and much-needed topic for public health students
the speaker series is good.
The first half of the course was slightly slow, very anecdote-heavy, but not super engaging. The speaker series was awesome and worth taking the class for.
None
I think the speakers were interesting. They had a lot of good "real world" anecdotes.
I enjoyed the lectures and the visiting speakers were great. I learned a lot of things I never would have learned from a book.
Easy class, cool guest lecturers
Class textbook is unreasonably expensive, students don't learn much reg. beyond the FDA, which is a bit misleading.
Great speakers and lectures

The array of guest lecturer invite by Professor Makuch were amazing! Without this class, we would not have the access to professionals in the regulatory sphere. I would appreciate it if we could go through the material in a more logical manner that follows the book/readings assigned.

The strength is that the professor knows the material inside out. The weakness is that there is no engaged learning. Our homework is to read from a very dry textbook and answer questions that can be easily found by skimming the pages. The homework doesn't support our learning or motivate critical thinking. Also, the professor doesn't help the students integrate the massive amount of information into a timeline or system. He just talks at. The TA could be useful here but she is a waste of space. She doesn't provide timely feedback for the homework or hold study sessions. The course could be easily improved by changing the content and the TA.
It was a fun course.
The seminars are very helpful that the professor invited professionals in the regulatory affairs field.
Guest lecturers were very good, but given other course commitments it is not feasible to change the required hours of the course lectures midway through the term.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Robert Makuch  Very knowledgeable on this topic brings in very informative speakers Class could benefit from more hands on learning activities or case studies
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Great. Very knowledgeable, but a little scatterbrained.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Dr. Makuch has so much experience and talks openly about the industry and FDA. He is a great mentor!
Instructor: Robert Makuch  He has great depth of real world experience that is refreshing to be exposed to since many other classes here are much more suited to academia.

Instructor: Robert Makuch  Dr. Makuch is great - his lectures are informative and interesting (driven by stories and experiences from his career). Also, his exams are fair and he brought in great speakers!

Instructor: Robert Makuch  Fantastic professor, tons of knowledge on the subjects, but sometimes easily distracted from the material. I don't think this is a problem because the stories were the true value of the course, but there were times where I didn't feel like I completely understood the material.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Dr. Makuch seems didn't put much effort in his teaching.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Good.

Instructor: Robert Makuch  Dr. Makuch has a lot of expertise and interesting stories. He tends to get a bit sidetracked during teaching, but most of his stories are interesting (you may hear them a few times though). Most of the speakers he brought in for the speaker series were very cool, though.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Great
Instructor: Robert Makuch  He clearly knows his stuff.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  I appreciated how his lectures didn't just rehash the book material. He was good at giving us a more realistic picture of regulatory affairs.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Fun guy, very knowledgable.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Extremely knowledgeable
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Professor Makuch has a lot of interesting and engaging stories and tangents about the field! I loved listening to all of his experiences and learning from him
Instructor: Robert Makuch  He is really knowledgeable but I don't think he cares whether we learn. I wish the tests were not open internet.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Cool professor
Instructor: Robert Makuch  The professor has great experiences in this area.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Improvements could be make to responsiveness to emails and availability outside of lecture time (office hours).

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The course and material is very dry, but the class itself does not come with a huge workload. I wouldn't recommend it to another student unless they had to take it or had extra space in their schedule to take it, because there are better/more interesting classes to take.
Overall, a great course to take if interested in FDA positions or knowledge. Very interdisciplinary perspective of regulatory affairs, from biotech to stats to law to policy.
I loved regulatory affairs. I would take it again.
Good class. Would recommend for anyone interested in regulatory affairs.
Hidden gem at YSPH - take it!!

Take this course if you are interested in reg affairs in any capacity, whether it is for statistical, pharma, or government work. The course provides an excellent overview of reg affairs, and the professor works hard to ensure you have both knowledge of the concepts as well as knowledge of what really goes on within the US government and its regulation of the pharma industry.
Don't take the course except you are in regulatory affairs track.
Recommend if especially interested in this area.
Good course
You should take this course if you have any interest in reg affairs and pharmaceuticals. It feels like a seminar and is interesting enough to keep your attention.
A valuable course.
A lot of information about how messy regulatory processes are sometimes.
This is an interesting introduction to regulatory affairs. I'm more interested in regulatory affairs after taking this course.
good class
This course consists of lectures by professor Makuch as well as guest lecturers! I would recommend to anyone who wants to learn more about the regulatory sphere around pharmaceutical products.
As long as you know where the content is in the book, you'll pass the course.
Probably would be easier with some background knowledge, but was a fun course.
A nice introduction to regulatory affairs and new drug development processes.
